conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
A (Orange liquid) flows downward and hits the yellow baffle.
B (Green liquid) flows downward and hits the yellow baffle.
C (Blue liquid) flows downward and hits the yellow baffle.
D (Yellow liquid) flows downward and directly hits the gray baffle.
Liquids A, B, and C hit the yellow baffle, which is slanted downward to the left, redirecting them to the left.
After leaving the yellow baffle, liquids A, B, and C flow downward and hit the brown baffle.
The brown baffle is slanted downward to the right, redirecting liquids A, B, and C to the right.
Liquids A, B, and C flow downward and hit the white baffle.
The white baffle is slanted downward to the left, redirecting liquids A, B, and C to the left.
Liquids A, B, and C flow downward into Container E.
Liquid D hits the gray baffle, which is slanted downward to the right, redirecting it to the right.
After leaving the gray baffle, liquid D flows downward directly into Container F.
Orange, Green, and Blue liquids (A, B, and C) will flow into Container E.
Yellow liquid (D) will flow into Container F.
Final answer: Container E will receive liquids from A, B, and C, and Container F will receive liquid from D.
